Mr. William G. Harley
May 8, 1962
Page #2
Board from here on out be held in Washington at our national headquarters and
that the fall meeting be held at our national convention.
Copies of the TV Board and Development Committee meeting minutes are attached
for your records.
I have a copy of a proposed project as prepared by Vernon Bronson and submitted
to Bill Bowden for a southeastern conference on matters of interchange with ETV
materials and signals. My instigation of this whole idea from the first was with
emphasis on interconnection of networks in the southeast where there exists as
nowhere in the nation a laboratory, partially equipped (ten ETV stations), for
such a project. This was to be studied in conference in Washington with Seth
Spaulding and then an approach to be made to the SREB and the NAEB.
This ready hatched proposal has had no participation in its preparation so far as
the AETC is concerned. Furthermore, it subordinates the prime objectives as
conceived in the AETC original idea. Likewise, it completely leaves out the part
that our NAEB could well play in sponsoring such an important project. The AETC's
interest in the idea is strictly professional with the NAEB taking a pre-eminent
part in its launching and its implementation.
I regret burdening you with this problem, but, if the AETC is to have any responsi¬
bility in this plan,,it will expect to be included in the decision on objectives.
Furthermore, the AETC will need to be satisfied that the objectives are within
reach or why bother. Chasing rabbits is too time consuming and Enervating.
Even though I withdrew the designation of John Dunn as the proposed chairman of
the NAEB committee for studying and presenting a revised plan for redistricting
NAEB, I feel that the idea is good for NAEB. This brings him back in the operation
in a functional manner and in a capacity that he can well fill. The more partici¬
pation we get on this sort of activity the more we relieve the administration of
such matters and lessen the burden at headquarters.
Sincerely yours,
RDH/ml
enc.
Chairman, TV Board
